title: 12. Challenges to Augustus’ Rule
description: Conspiracies, opposition, and challenges faced by Augustus, and how ancient sources interpret these threats.

questions.question: Which two figures were most closely associated with the conspiracy against Augustus around 23 BCE?
Which ancient author first mentions the conspiracy of Caepio and Murena?
Why do modern historians debate whether the Caepio–Murena conspiracy actually occurred?
options: There are no surviving ancient sources
It may have been used as a pretext to remove opposition

questions.question: Who provided Augustus with information about the alleged conspiracy?
Who presided over the court that tried Caepio and Murena?
What was the outcome of the trial of Caepio and Murena?
What personal connection may have linked Murena to Maecenas?
options: Murena was married to his daughter
Murena was the brother of Maecenas’ wife

questions.question: Why may Murena already have been viewed unfavourably by Augustus?
In the trial of Primus, what defence did Murena initially present?
options: That the Senate approved the action

questions.question: Whom did Murena later claim had actually issued the orders to Primus?
Why was Murena’s testimony about Marcellus potentially damaging to Augustus?
options: It exposed corruption in the Senate
It suggested the succession was being concealed

questions.question: How did Augustus behave during the trial of Primus?
What justification did Augustus give for appearing at the trial uninvited?
options: It was in the public interest

questions.question: What was the verdict in the trial of Primus?
Which later conspirator was linked to the final use of the senatus consultum ultimum?
How did Augustus respond to the conspiracy of Cinna in 16 BCE, according to Seneca?
What general warning does Tacitus give about accounts of conspiracies against Augustus?
options: They are unreliable due to flattery
They ignore the role of the Senate
